name: Manoel Horta Ribeiro
content: Manoel Horta Ribeiro CS Skip to main content Manoel Horta Ribeiro Assistant Professor Contact Building 302A Sherrerd Hall Envelope mh3586@cs.princeton.edu Phone (609) 258-7220 Diploma Ph.D., École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne, 2024 Research Areas Machine Learning Natural Language Processing Law & Public Policy Human-Computer Interaction Short Bio I'm an Assistant Professor at Princeton University in the Department of Computer Science, affiliated with the Princeton Center for Information Technology Policy (CITP). I received my doctoral degree in Switzerland, at École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne’s Data Science Lab, working with Bob West, and my MSc and BSc in Brazil, at Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais. During my doctorate, I worked closely with several companies, including Meta, Reddit, Prolific, and Microsoft.I work at the intersection of computational social science, artificial intelligence, and social computing. I like doing research that tackles real-world issues and provides actionable insights. Ideally, these insights translate into policy and design changes. My work has also received extensive media coverage, helping shape the public debate around online platforms and generative AI.More information and publications are available here. Other Affiliations CITP Related News March 13, 2025 Manoel Horta Ribeiro, expert in social computing, joins the faculty Manoel Horta Ribeiro has joined the computer science department as an assistant professor.
